006
007package renderer.models_LP;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker;
012
013/**
014   Create a wireframe model of a frustum of a right square pyramid
015   with its base in the xz-plane.
016<p>
017   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frustum" target="_top">
018                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frustum</a>
019
020   @see Pyramid
021*/
022public class PyramidFrustum extends Model implements MeshMaker
023{
024   public final double s1;
025   public final double s2;
026   public final double h;
027   public final int n;
028   public final int k;
029
030   /**
031      Create a frustum of a right square pyramid with its base in the
032      xz-plane, a base side length of 2, top side length of 1, and height 1/2.
033   */
034   public PyramidFrustum( )
035   {
036      this(2.0, 1.0, 0.5, 7, 4);
037   }
038
039
040   /**
041      Create a frustum of a right square pyramid with its base in the
042      xz-plane, a base side length of {@code s1}, top side length of
043      {@code s2}, and height {@code h}.
044   <p>
045      This model works with either {@code s1 > s2} or {@code s1 < s2}.
046      In other words, the frustum can have its "apex" either above or
047      below the xz-plane.
048
049      @param s1  side length of the base of the frustum
050      @param s2  side length of the top of the frustum
051      @param h   height of the frustum
052   */
053   public PyramidFrustum(final double s1, final double s2, final double h)
054   {
055      super(String.format("Pyramid Frustum(%.2f,%.2f,%.2f)", s1, s2, h));
056
057      this.s1 = s1;
058      this.s2 = s2;
059      this.h = h;
060      this.n = 1;
061      this.k = 1;
062
063      // Create the pyramid's geometry.
064      addVertex(new Vertex(-s1/2, 0, -s1/2),  // base
065                new Vertex(-s1/2, 0,  s1/2),
066                new Vertex( s1/2, 0,  s1/2),
067                new Vertex( s1/2, 0, -s1/2),
068                new Vertex(-s2/2, h, -s2/2),  // top
069                new Vertex(-s2/2, h,  s2/2),
070                new Vertex( s2/2, h,  s2/2),
071                new Vertex( s2/2, h, -s2/2));
072
073      // Create 6 faces.
074      addPrimitive(new LineLoop(0, 1, 2, 3),           // base
075                   new Lines(0, 4, 1, 5, 2, 6, 3, 7),  // sides
076                   new LineLoop(4, 5, 6, 7));          // top
077   }
078
079
080   /**
081      Create a frustum of a right square pyramid with its base in the
082      xz-plane, a base side length of {@code s}, top of the frustum at
083      height {@code h}, and with the pyramid's apex at on the y-axis at
084      height {@code a}.
085
086      @param n  number of lines of latitude
087      @param k  number of lines of longitude
088      @param s  side length of the base of the frustum
089      @param h  height of the frustum
090      @param a  height of the apex of the pyramid
091      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 0
092      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 1
093   */
094   public PyramidFrustum(final int n, final int k,
095                         final double s, final double h, final double a)
096   {
097      this(s, (1 - h/a)*s, h, n, k);
098   }
099
100
101   /**
102      Create a frustum of a right square pyramid with its base in the
103      xz-plane, a base side length of {@code s1}, top side length of
104      {@code s2}, and height {@code h}.
105   <p>
106      This model works with either {@code s1 > s2} or {@code s1 < s2}.
107      In other words, the frustum can have its "apex" either above or
108      below the xz-plane.
109
110      @param s1  side length of the base of the frustum
111      @param s2  side length of the top of the frustum
112      @param h   height of the frustum
113      @param n   number of lines of latitude
114      @param k   number of lines of longitude
115      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 0
116      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 1
117   */
118   public PyramidFrustum(double s1, double s2, double h,
119                         final int n, final int k)
120   {
121      super(String.format("Pyramid Frustum(%.2f,%.2f,%.2f,%d,%d)",
122                                           s1,  s2,  h,   n, k));
123
124      if (n < 0)
125         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n must be greater than or equal to 0");
126      if (k < 1)
127         throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater than 0");
128
129      this.s1 = s1;
130      this.s2 = s2;
131      this.h = h;
132      this.n = n;
133      this.k = k;
134
135      // Create the frustum's geometry.
136      int index = 0;
137
138      // Create all the lines of longitude from the top, down to the base,
139      // across the base, then back up to the top, and across the top.
140      s1 = s1/2;
141      s2 = s2/2;
142      final double delta1 = (2 * s1) / k,
143                   delta2 = (2 * s2) / k;
144      // lines of "longitude" perpendicular to the x-axis
145      for (int j = 0; j <= k; ++j)
146      {
147         final double d1 = j * delta1,
148                      d2 = j * delta2;
149         addVertex(new Vertex(-s2+d2, h, -s2),
150                   new Vertex(-s1+d1, 0, -s1),
151                   new Vertex(-s1+d1, 0,  s1),
152                   new Vertex(-s2+d2, h,  s2));
153         addPrimitive(new LineLoop(index+0, index+1, index+2, index+3));
154         index += 4;
155      }
156      // lines of "longitude" perpendicular to the z-axis
157      for (int j = 0; j <= k; ++j)
158      {
159         final double d1 = j * delta1,
160                      d2 = j * delta2;
161         addVertex(new Vertex( s2, h, -s2+d2),
162                   new Vertex( s1, 0, -s1+d1),
163                   new Vertex(-s1, 0, -s1+d1),
164                   new Vertex(-s2, h, -s2+d2));
165         addPrimitive(new LineLoop(index+0, index+1, index+2, index+3));
166         index += 4;
167      }
168      // Create all the lines of "latitude" around the pyramid, starting
169      // from the base and working up to the top.
170      final double deltaH = h / (n + 1),
171                   deltaS = (s1 - s2) / (n + 1);
172      double s = s1;
173      for (int i = 0; i <= n; ++i)
174      {
175         h = i * deltaH;
176         addVertex(new Vertex( s, h,  s),
177                   new Vertex( s, h, -s),
178                   new Vertex(-s, h, -s),
179                   new Vertex(-s, h,  s));
180         addPrimitive(new LineLoop(index+0, index+1, index+2, index+3));
181         s -= deltaS;
182         index += 4;
183      }
184   }
185
186
187
188   // Implement the MeshMaker interface (three methods).
189   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return n;}
190
191   @Override public int getVertCount() {return k;}
192
193   @Override
194   public PyramidFrustum remake(final int n, final int k)
195   {
196      return new PyramidFrustum(this.s1, this.s2,
197                                this.h,
198                                n, k);
199   }
200}//PyramidFrustum
